resources.string:
Jaipur is the capital of India’s Rajasthan state. It evokes the royal family that once ruled the region and that, in 1727, founded what is now called the Old City, or “Pink City” for its trademark building color. At the center of its stately street grid (notable in India) stands the opulent, colonnaded City Palace complex. With gardens, courtyards and museums, part of it is still a royal residence.

Area: 484.6 km²
Population: 30.7 lakhs
Amer is a fort with-in an area of 4 square kilometres located high on a hill, it is the principal tourist attraction in Jaipur.
Hawa Mahal is a palace constructed of red and pink sandstone. The palace sits on the edge of the City Palace.
City Palace, which includes the Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal palaces and other buildings, is a palace complex.
Nahargarh Fort stands on the edge of the Aravalli Hills, overlooking the city of Jaipur. It once formed strong defence ring of the city.
It is the oldest museum of the state and functions as the State museum of Rajasthan.
Jewelry with precious gemstones, and handmade necklaces are some of the best things available at reasonable prices here.
Ensure you buy the colorful pots and wooden souvenirs from this shopping place.
World Trade Park is a high class shopping mall in Malviya Nagar, Jaipur.
Best quality Jaipur textile goods are present here. However, be ready to bargain!
The best grill restaurant in town is here with their trademark veg and non-veg starters.
Chokhi Dhani is a concept capturing the vibrant spirit of Rajasthan and ensuring a perfect Rajasthani experience.
The fine-dining restaurant serves cuisine from the four Indian Princely States—Rajputana, Awadh, Hyderabad and Kashmir.
Raj Mandir Cinema is a movie theatre in Jaipur
